With interest in mobile gaming increasing and gamers using their devices for longer periods of time, extra pressure is put on the smartphone’s processor, screen and battery with the possibility of overheating occurring.


The GameSir F8 Pro Snowgon solves this problem whilst also providing a cosy handgrip. With its advanced semiconductor refrigeration technology, the F8 Pro Snowgon cools the smartphone down instantly once connected, ensuring peace of mind during long gaming sessions.

✅Born for users at all levels.
✅Instant refrigeration.
✅Supporting both Android &
column3:
durable stretch design.
✅Exclusively designed stick-on joystick.
✅Ergonomic handgrip.
✅Foldable phone holder.
✅Dynamic RGB backlight.

 

 

We are proud of what we have created to date but need your help to push it over the limit. By supporting us, you will witness the birth of GameSir F8 Pro Mobile Cooling Grip. We have a fully functional physical model of the device now and all funds raised will go directly to funding the final mass production. We would like you to join us on our journey to bring the product to life.
As early backers, we are keen on rewarding you with some unique perks. All GameSir F8 Pro Mobile Cooling Grip perks up to 44% off from the planned retail price-   
buy one, $35 / PCS, 22% off
column5:
buy 10 PCS, $25 / PCS, 44% off.
GameSir Talons Finger Sleeves will be as a gift with the F8 Pro. The first deliveries will begin in Aug 2021 - only for early backers.

What prizes will the lucky backers receive?

The 1st Prize, one GameSir F8 Pro Mobile Cooling Grip for FREE, 3 lucky backers.

The 2nd Prize, one GameSir F4 Falcon Mobile Controller for FREE, 5 lucky backers.

The 3rd Prize, one GameSir F2 Grip for FREE, 10 lucky backers.

We will post the list of lucky backers on our Facebook.

The prizes will be sent together with GameSir F8 Pro ordered on Indiegogo in Aug 2021.

As always, we will provide free shipping.

 

 

 

 

Note：Before you pledge, please make sure that your delivery destination is listed as followed, otherwise, we cannot deliver your items.

（1）Europe: Germany, Britain, France, Spain, Italy

（2）North America: United States, Canada

（3）South America: Brazil

（4）Asia: Japan, Malaysia

（5）Australia: Australia, New Zealand

（6）Middle East: Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates 

Free shipping for all.

In order to make more gamers can enjoy the sheer joy brought by our product, GameSir is striving to cooperate with the global well-renowned logistics companies. However, allowing for complicated and uncontrolled factors, some countries and regions are still out of reach, we are sorry to those gamers, but we are working on expanding our delivery range. We believe that in the near future, you shall experience our products crafted by passion and out-of-state technology. Thank you for your attention to this campaign.

 

 

 

 

  1.  Does it need to set up Bluetooth or additional software?

No. Just connect power, switch “ON” and you can play.

  1.  Can it be used wirelessly?

  No. It has no built-in battery and can only use wired connection. However, for portable use, you can connect it with your charge pal.

  1.  Does it support playing while charging?

  Yes, there is reserved space for the charging interface.

  1.  Can it be used with phone protection cover?

   The cooling effect is better without a phone protection cover.

  1.  Is the headset supported?

   Yes, there is reserved space for the headset. Only if the headset cable can be passed through it, then the headset is supported.

  1.  How long does it need for cooling down the phone?

  1 second after well-connected.

  1.  Is the fan noisy?

  It’s common that there will be noise on any fan. However, the fan on F8 Pro is equipped with noise reduction technology, reaching as low as 32 decibels.

  1.  How about the phone compatiblity?

  It’s compatible with both Android &
column6:
iOS phones, up to 173mm in length.

  1.  Can the backlight be changed?

  No, it can’t.

column1: What’s the lowest temperature it can reach?

The GameSir Lab tested at an ambient temperature of 25℃, under which the temperature of the heat dissipation surface was as low as 5℃. The cooling effect may vary due to different using environment. Please refer to the actual situation.

  1.  What are the differences between GameSir F8 Pro &
column2:
other similar phone coolers?

GameSir F8 Pro is the world's first combination of a handgrip and a cooler, providing users with a better handheld gaming experience while cooling down the phone.

  1.  Does it cool down a phone by the fan?

 No, it works based on semiconductor refrigeration. The fan is used for the heat dissipation of the semiconductor.

Note:

There may be droplets when removing the phone from F8 Pro, which is normal due to refrigeration.

Only if the headset cable can be passed through it, then the headset is supported. How long does it need for cooling down the phone?  1 second after well-connected. Is the fan noisy?  It’s common that there will be noise on any fan. However, the fan on F8 Pro is equipped with noise reduction technology, reaching as low as 32 decibels. How about the phone compatiblity?   It’s compatible with both Android & iOS phones, up to 173mm in length. Can the backlight be changed?  No, it can’t.

column1: What’s the lowest temperature it can reach?

The GameSir Lab tested at an ambient temperature of 25℃, under which the temperature of the heat dissipation surface was as low as 5℃. The cooling effect may vary due to different using environment. Please refer to the actual situation. What are the differences between GameSir F8 Pro & other similar phone coolers?GameSir F8 Pro is the world's first combination of a handgrip and a cooler, providing users with a better handheld gaming experience while cooling down the phone. Does it cool down a phone by the fan? No, it works based on semiconductor refrigeration. The fan is used for the heat dissipation of the semiconductor.Note: There may be droplets when removing the phone from F8 Pro, which is normal due to refrigeration.",38.0,0,"4 Campaigns

iKlip is compatible with: iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6, iPhone 5s, iPhone 5, iPad Air 2, iPad mini 3, iPad Air, iPad mini 2, iPad (4th generation), iPod Touch (5th generation).

Will it fit an iPhone, iPad inside the case?

If it is original Apple case it will fit. If it is a waterproof case (Otterbox or LifeProof) - it will not fit.
Do I need an app to use iKlips?
Yes, there is a free iOS app you can download from App Store (search: iKlips) or scan QR code to download it.
No, iKlips can store and stream media files (.mp3,.wav,.mp4,.mov file formats support) and documents (.pdf, .txt, .doc, .docx, .xls, .xlsx, .ppt, .pptx, .jpg, .png, .tiff, .gif, .bmp).

VoCore is now in store on its own site, http://vocore.io/store


What is VoCore?

VoCore is a coin-sized Linux computer with wifi. It is also able to work as a full functional router. It runs OpenWrt on top of Linux. It contains 32MB SDRAM, 8MB SPI Flash and using RT5350(360MHz MIPS) as its heart. It provides many interfaces such as 10/100M Ethernet, USB, UART, I2C, I2S, PCM, JTAG and over 20 GPIOs but its size is less than one square inch(25mm x 25mm).

column1: Initial costs for the 1st production run is approximately $12,000 per flavor. If we don't hit our goal of $44,000, we will aim to co-pack 1 flavor at this time.

GAMER started as a name, but will always be more than just trendy branding. GAMER is all about quality! Sweetened with real sugar, fortified with vitamins, and never a trace of artificial colors or high fructose corn syrup. Better ingredients + light carbonation = a very refreshing soda experience with GAMER!

column1: From our family at DSJ Beverages, LLC, THANK YOU SO MUCH for your support!

Hi, I'm Gary, the Founder of GAMER, THE beverage brand created specifically for...the video gamer. Many moons ago I was watching my teenage son play video games, when the idea for GAMER popped into my noggin. My 3 boys, relatives & friends all loved the concept, but what were the odds that one of the ""big boys"" didn't already own the trademark for such an obvious name...a brand for gamers called GAMER? We hired a great attorney and were very pleasantly surprised to find no such trademark! With great excitement, we decided as a family to trademark the name & get to work creating a delicious, high quality brand with the video game enthusiast in mind!

We launched GAMER as a soda, May, 2009, and continue to operate locally as a family business. GAMER receives awesome consumer feedback wherever we sample, so it's time to improve access to beverage enthusiats everywhere. Expanding production into non-breakable containers will help make GAMER more readily accessible for our fans.

Importantly, we have benefited as a family from charitable organizations & have made it our mission to give back too! Expanding our business gives us more opportunity to help local & nationals causes!
What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $44,000 in funds to package 2 of our most popular GAMER flavors, puchase a gently worn delivery van, and provide warehousing, marketing, and insurance as part of this next step. We will co-pack in cans primarily because the shelf life is 4x longer than plastic. Unlike our current glass bottle packaging, cans are high-volume fill, which means you have to commit a significant amount of dough before you fill your 1st can. This includes design & pre-purchase of thousands of cases of printed empty cans. When it's time to fill, minimum runs are 1,000 cases...enought to fill a tractor trailer. Once packaged, we need to pay for shipping & warehousing before we're ready to start delivering to customers. We have many pre-orders for GAMER from non-retail vendors...rec baseball programs, skateboard parks, hockey arenas, paintball fields, etc. Since our distributors serve retailers only, a delivery van becomes critical.

In return for your generous & most appreciated support, we have a bunch of exciting perks! GAMER stickers, pens, koozies, t-shirts, hats, hoodies, and of course, our delicious GAMER soda! If you're a collector, we have a unique offerring: autographed & authenticated GAMER soda packs from our very 1st production run! Imagine if GAMER goes worldwide someday!
Initial costs for the 1st production run is approximately $12,000 per flavor. If we don't hit our goal of $44,000, we will aim to co-pack 1 flavor at this time.

GAMER started as a name, but will always be more than just trendy branding. GAMER is all about quality! Sweetened with real sugar, fortified with vitamins, and never a trace of artificial colors or high fructose corn syrup. Better ingredients + light carbonation = a very refreshing soda experience with GAMER!

A number of our more mature GAMER fans have inquired about an ""energy"" version. This is part of our original business plan, and success with the expansion into non-breakable containers could get things in motion sooner for GAMER Energy. Our sodas were carefully planned & created as a ""hybrid"" beverage, so we promise to do the same with an energy drink. GAMER Energy will be BOTH functional & delicious!

The US & World economy has been tough for a long time now, so we understand if you are not able to contribute. Either way, we would love everyone's support to spread the word about GAMER and help bring friends & family to our campaign through IndieGogo quick links.
From our family at DSJ Beverages, LLC, THANK YOU SO MUCH for your support!

The goal of this project is to build a free web-based version of our software development tool LogicGem. LogicGem is a logic processor and decision table analysis tool. LogicGem has a two-fold audience, software developers (programmers) and business analysts (non-programmers). The common thread between these two diverse groups is that they both need to design logically complete business rules.

For the programmer, the business rules are in fact functional requirements for a software application that are translated into a programming language that becomes part of the application. For the business analyst or domain expert, the same need exists with the exception of translating the logic to a programming language. Business analysts need to develop concise business rules that represent real life or proposed business processes and these processes need to be every bit as logically robust as a software implementation. Collectively, we can refer to both groups of programmers and business analysts as a ""logic engineer"".

LogicGem is a software tool called a ""logic processor"" that addresses these issues using decision table theory. LogicGem consists of a logic editor, and logic compiler. With the logic editor shown above, you can create logic tables — spreadsheet-like constructions that encapsulate a set of logical rules.

Much of the effort in software development does not involve writing code, but rather the process of covering every possible combination of circumstances — user input, database transaction, or any other event — that the program will encounter. When the programmer or analyst overlooks a possible combination of inputs or events, the program may do things essentially at random. Even worse are errors made during program maintenance, usually by programmers who do not fully understand the interaction between dozens of different possibilities. As it is, logical analysis is tedious and error prone: it's easy to omit, duplicate, or contradict conditions.

column2: >Figure 2 - LogicGem Finds Missing, Redundant and Contradictory Rules

column1: The LogicGem logic processor is designed to provide a familiar, easy-to-use way to create, edit, verify and compile decision table logic. LogicGem's logic tables express a problem visually, making it easy to understand. One part of a table contains conditions that can be linked to create a rule, and the other part contains actions that are related to the rules.

Once you've defined the rules, to ensure that a table's logic is complete, unambiguous and contains every applicable rule in an expanded or reduced format, the editor will automatically analyze them, add missing rules, and remove those that are redundant or contradictory. Decision table technology is the vehicle by which logically complete business rules may be constructed.

When you're done perfecting the rules, the logic compiler is available to generate source code in Basic, C, C++, Fortran, FoxPro, Java, Pascal, PowerBuilder, SAS, Visual Basic, Visual Basic.NET, Visual C#.NET, or Xbase programming languages.

The compiler will produce a set of English, Spanish, French or German rules that can be used as documentation or as a knowledge base. LogicGem provides the means to prototype and expand a high-level procedural concept into a decision table, work it through analysis and design phases, and then generate English language documentation.

The new free web version of LogicGem will bring a popular logic processor to business analysts and programmers everywhere. This will mean more logically complete business rules and processes and software with fewer bugs. In order to get a better idea of how LogicGem works, here are two tutorial videos:
Video for Business Analysts
You can read all about LogicGem by going to our Technical Reference guide and our QuickStart Guide (PDF) is also available.
You can also download a FREE 30-day trial version of LogicGem (without a serial number, LogicGem will install as a fully functional evaluation copy).

In order to pull this off we need to fund a development project that will take the C source code of our current downloadable software and convert it to run on the web. We'll also need funding for hosting services.

For LogicGem product rewards, you can download the Trial version above (which is the fully functioning product just without a serial number) and we will e-mail you your LogicGem serial number within 24 hours.
If you're unable to pledge our project, please help out by spreading the word of the LogicGem Web project on your social networks in order for the project to go viral!

The iShove Wallet for iPhone 5 and 5S combines the beautiful look of an aluminum bumper with the functionalities of a wallet and it's even got a credit card stand, while your phone is always 100% accessible!
""iShove Wallet: The Best iPhone 5/5s Wallet Case We’ve Seen""
""iShove Wallet - Brand New Dutch Design""
""iShove Wallet"" - Beautiful iPhone 5/5S Wallet Case With Card Stand""
designed the iShove Wallet because we think that most of the iPhone wallets on
the market are making your iPhone very bulky, hard to use and ugly to look at. The
iShove Wallet hasn’t got these problems. It has a beautiful look, is very thin,
it has got a credit card stand and you can always use your iPhone easily.
The front view of the iPhone is more beautiful created by the aluminum bumper, which also gives your iPhone a good protection.
The back side is made from a high-quality high-gloss plastic that also gives the back side a nice look.
You can cary everything you need with instand access to your iPhone

The iShove Wallet is able to carry 4 cards and 3 bills in the card section and there’s a secret compartment where you can stash 2 keys.  Of course you can use it in the way you like. You can also use the secret compartment to stash a bill, some coins or for example your medications. And you can use the card section to carry less cards and more bills and business cards, that’s your choice.
The total thickness is limited to 0.6 inches, which is much thinner than most iPhone Wallets on the market and it fits perfectly in your pocket.
Wallet even has a credit card stand that allows you to put your iPhone in
portrait of landscape mode. It’s very easy to use. You only need to get a card
from your iShove Wallet and the stand is ready to use.
The built-in credit card stand is very useful if you for example want to watch a movie on your iPhone.
The credit card stand is also very good to use as stand for the iPhone navigation in your car.
The iShove Wallet is very easy to use!
iShove Wallet is very easy to use. Just shove the backside down to open the
wallet section, easily get you card or cash, pay with it, put it back down and
close the wallet. To access the secret compartment you need to shove out the
entire backside. This is the only way people can see what you have stashed in

column2: >The iShove Wallet works by raising your iPhone away from surfaces protecting the edges and absorbing the shock from bumps and knocks.
>The iShove Wallet raises the iPhone from surface contact.
>Rubber Lining acts as a shock absorber to minimize impact damage to your iPhone and also protects when your installing the iShove Wallet.
>It has a simple slide cover. You don't need screws or tools, it simply glides on and locks into place.

column1: iShove Wallet is available in 10 color combinations. You can choose the backside
in black or white, depending on the color of your iPhone, in combination with
the aluminium bumper in the colours black, blue, red, silver or pink.

column2: >We will send you an e-mail in which you can specify the desired color combination.

column1: Combine your iShove Wallet with a mirror!
With this handy mirror pass you will always have a mirror with you.
We have chosen to run a flexible campaign. This means for sure that the iShove Wallet will go into production!
It's our goal to ship the iShove Wallet at the start of december 2013.
1) For which phones is the iShove Wallet suitable?

column2: >The iShove Wallet is suiteble for iPhone 5 and 5S.

column1: 2) How many can I carry with the iShove Wallet?

• The iShove Wallet is able to carry 4 cards, 3 bills and 2 keys. When you decide to carry for example 2 cards, you are able to carry more bills. You can also swap the keys for your medications or a spare bill.
• Yes we do! We'll ship for free, worldwide.

Tabber lets you order anything at restaurants and bars without having to wait for service! Just get a table, open Tabber on your smartphone and select whatever you want from the menu. The order goes directly to the restaurant without having to talk to anyone. You also pay your tab with Tabber, eliminating any delay in your dining experience!

I'm sure YOU had this problem many times, haven't you? Waiting for the menu, waiting to place an order, waiting to pay the tab... There is a whole lot of waiting in the way restaurants operate - which can be translated into FRUSTRATION for the customer and INEFFICIENCY for the venue.
Tabber solves this issue forever - no more waiting! All of it within a single app that works in any registered restaurant. Check it out, it is available both in the App Store and Google Play.
It all started when four of us were trying to order another drink at a restaurant... The waiter was nowhere to be found, and while we waited in frustration, we were all browsing on our smartphones.
BINGO! Why not order our drinks with our own smartphones? Why wait for the server to come to our table? At that moment, TABBER was born.

After developing the technology we ran a pilot program with 8 restaurants for 4 months, and the results were amazing! Everyone loved the experience and the restaurants were very happy to see that people using Tabber spent on average 24.5% more than their regular customers!

With over 65 years of combined professional experience in technology, and top-level business track record, our team took the idea and turned it into a world-class solution that is already operational in the USA and Brazil on a small scale.

What we need right now are the resources to aggressively execute our go-to-market strategy to make our technology widely available in restaurants all over the US. Together, we can change the restaurant experience forever!
<h3>What We Will do With Your Money &amp

Now that we already have the technology in place, we are asking for US$ 50,000 to get us started in promoting Tabber and spreading the word. We will hire a couple of sales people and spend some cash in social media campaigns. Obviously, what we are asking is not enough to really take us all the way, but we take it one step at a time. With the progress generated by this amount, we will be in a much better position to raise more if necessary - and to start generating our own consistent revenue that will be re-invested into the company. Our only goal is to have as many restaurants as possible.
In order to express our gratitude towards your involvement in this cause, we have set up a few rewards:
$1 - You get a Thank You email with some inside scoop about our plans
$10 - Your name in the ""credits"" page in our website
$20 - Your name in the ""credits"" page in our mobile apps + all of the above
$40 - Get a Tabber ""Early Supporter"" t-shirt + all of the above
$60 - Get a $10 coupon on Tabber + all of the above
$100 - Get a $20 coupon on Tabber + all of the above
$400 - Get five $10 coupons to give to your friends + all of the above
$1,000 - Get a special personalized Tabber app + all of the above
$5,000 - Tabber Task Force for two days to get restaurants signed up in your area (USA) + all of the above
One of the most important rewards that everyone gets automatically is the fact that you will be helping us to get Tabber installed in restaurants near you very soon!
So you liked Tabber, but you can't contribute with cash. That's fine, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:
** Share Tabber's campaign with your friends on Twitter, Facebook or anything else that can help us reach more people.
** Talk to restaurants in your area and ask them to reach out to us. They can start using Tabber for free and without any risk! The email is restaurant@tabber.pro

BrokeMyCell.com was launched in October 2012 with $60,000 by a father of 2 young boys. Our founder having shattered the screen on a once brand new Samsung Galaxy S3 concluded that he had no repair options and the replacement cost for the phone was $649. By accident a glaring need for a professional, accessible, and affordable cell phone repair solution was identified.

BrokeMyCell offers affordable repair solutions for the current most expensive and popular mobile phones and devices. By concentrating parts and technical talent on the most common repair problems: Broken Glass Screens, and LCD's. BrokeMyCell.com is able to offer competitive prices and industry leading technical expertise.

The majority of consumers do not have cell phone insurance and those that do find out the that a $200 deductible is typically required for popular phones including iPhones and Galaxy devices. Not to mention the $10-$15+ a month the customer pays for the 'peace of mind' of having insurance.

When customers contact BrokeMyCell and learn that most of our screen replacement repairs are around $100 to $150 they are thrilled. The days of a $50 flip-phone are long gone replaced by devices in our pockets and purses that cost closer to $1,000 so an affordable repair service provider has become a necessity.

If you dropped, kicked, crushed, threw, sat, squished... your brand new Samsung Galaxy S3, Note II, iPhone, 4, 5… and your broke your phone. Don't worry BrokeMyCell.com specializes in shattered screen and LCD repair and guarantees the fix! Repairs are competed in under 2 days and are shipped back worldwide with insurance.
Galaxy S3 with broken front glass screen and broken LCD
iPhone 5 Broken Front Glass
OUR GOAL is to make BrokeMyCell.com a household name and the worldwide leader for cell phone repairs &
column2: parts. So we need your help to continue our growth! We would like to raise $30,000 in 31 days to help us with:

column1: • Add additional phones to our repair menu
• Increase our repair parts inventory to speed up turnarounds
• Purchase additional accessories/parts for retail on BrokeMyCell.com

BrokeMyCell.com has been live for less than 6 months and is already averaging over 15,000 unique visitors each month with over $12,000.00 in online sales MTD (as of 4/25) for April alone. And the best part is that all the traffic and revenue is ORGANIC. BrokeMyCell.com was built from the ground up to integrate with social media and organic search engine results. In 6 months only $200 has been spent on advertising!

For those that know ecommerce, organic rankings and conversions are the ultimate goal and key measure for a profitable long term strategy. It is impressive for a baby start-up to dominate key search engine rankings and provide conversions and revenue so quickly and efficiently.
Chart from April 25 shows April MTD 'This Month' and March 'Last Month'

In 2014, the Internet covers (almost) the entire world. The Internet, the World will illuminate today's Internet with a book, CD. visuals and website. The funding will be used to send award-winning journalist Dave Burstein to join leaders of 150 nations coming to the ITU Plenipotentiary in Busan, Korea. If enough money is raised, video producer Jennie Bourne will join. Take a look at fastnetnews.com to see the quality of Dave's reporting or bournedigital.com for the quality of Jennie's video.

The Internet was built by men like these who will be remembered by history.
(The people in the pictures represent history. None of them endorses this project.)

column2: >    Today's net looks more like this Daniel Orth photo,

column1: I'm looking for the answers to the question, What will the Internet be like when there are more Africans than Americans? Cisco projects that will happen in 2017. India will also soon pass the United States. China in 2014 has twice as many. over 200 million. Latin America is booming.
column2: >More than half of today's Internet users are people of color.

>    Since 1999, I've reported broadband and the Internet as it spread from America to Europe, Korea, Japan and now to the rest of the world. Within ten years, three quarters of Net users will be from the emerging world, led by the BRICs and expanding everywhere. I know the technologies, including 4G/5G wireless and can project the numbers. To provide the full picture, I need to know more of the people. ITU Busan will have more people, from more countries, than any other Internet event before 2018. It's an opportunity I don't want to miss. International Telecommunications Union event will have thousands of attendees, usually including the Ministers and top policy people. There's nothing else that even comes close.
>    As a well-known reporter in this field, I'll have access to almost everyone. At the WCIT conference in Dubai, I interviewed the ITU Secretary-General, the U.S. Ambassador, Kenyan &amp
column3: Nigerian Ministers and many more. In Korea,  I'll be speaking to dozens of people like that and literally hundreds of others.

column2: >     We offer information in return for your support. For $10 to $60, briefings, emails and even a book. For those in business with a need to know, $125 buys you an individual briefing. Eor $225, I'll research any topic or country you're interested in and report to you. For $800, I'll spend a day with your team covering in detail what is going on. (Plus travel if needed) Satellite rules in East Africa? Competition in Kenya? Regulation in Chile? Community access to India's fiber going to 250,000 communities? International sources of finance for Central America? These are topics I can research and report.

>      For two weeks in Busan, my main work will be asking ""What is the Internet like in your country? How will things change? What can the international community and institutions do to help you bring the net to the unserved, make it robust and keep the cost affordable? Who are the people to watch, especially young people, that will create the future?"" Mostly I'll be listening for what other issues are important.

I've already spoken with Secretary-General Hamadoun Touré, successor, Houlin Zhao, U.S. Ambassador Sepulveda, Facebook's drone guy, and folks at nearly every major U.S. net company. In Busan, I'll interview dozens of leaders from around the world. My real strength is technical - I have depth in DSL, cable, fiber and now 4G/5G wireless.

The world needs to know how the Internet is changing and I intend to be one of those telling the story.
column6:
>I've written two books. I've spoken at Columbia, the U.S. Broadband Plan, the ITU Broadband Commission and around the Western world. My reporting has been picked up by the NY Times, Wall Street Journal and slews of technical publications. 
     $2,500 will cover part of the expenses for one reporter.  For twice that, we can add a very experienced video producer. If we get company interest and support beyond that, we'll spend it all on further travel to learn more.
      If you're in the telecom business, you'll recognize the perks and reporting cost less than half what we would be paid consulting on the same topics.

column1:
Please help us understand and report how the Internet will change in the next decade.
Dave Burstein
column2:
> 



","In 2014, the Internet covers (almost) the entire world. The Internet, the World will illuminate today's Internet with a book, CD. visuals and website. The funding will be used to send award-winning journalist Dave Burstein to join leaders of 150 nations coming to the ITU Plenipotentiary in Busan, Korea. If enough money is raised, video producer Jennie Bourne will join. Take a look at fastnetnews.com to see the quality of Dave's reporting or bournedigital.com for the quality of Jennie's video.The Internet was built by men like these who will be remembered by history.

column1: (The people in the pictures represent history. None of them endorses this project.)
Today's net looks more like this Daniel Orth photo,

I'm looking for the answers to the question, What will the Internet be like when there are more Africans than Americans? Cisco projects that will happen in 2017. India will also soon pass the United States. China in 2014 has twice as many. over 200 million. Latin America is booming. More than half of today's Internet users are people of color.

Since 1999, I've reported broadband and the Internet as it spread from America to Europe, Korea, Japan and now to the rest of the world. Within ten years, three quarters of Net users will be from the emerging world, led by the BRICs and expanding everywhere. I know the technologies, including 4G/5G wireless and can project the numbers. To provide the full picture, I need to know more of the people. ITU Busan will have more people, from more countries, than any other Internet event before 2018. It's an opportunity I don't want to miss. International Telecommunications Union event will have thousands of attendees, usually including the Ministers and top policy people. There's nothing else that even comes close.

As a well-known reporter in this field, I'll have access to almost everyone. At the WCIT conference in Dubai, I interviewed the ITU Secretary-General, the U.S. Ambassador, Kenyan & Nigerian Ministers and many more. In Korea,  I'll be speaking to dozens of people like that and literally hundreds of others.
Your perks: Information, including confidential research

We offer information in return for your support. For $10 to $60, briefings, emails and even a book. For those in business with a need to know, $125 buys you an individual briefing. Eor $225, I'll research any topic or country you're interested in and report to you. For $800, I'll spend a day with your team covering in detail what is going on. (Plus travel if needed) Satellite rules in East Africa? Competition in Kenya? Regulation in Chile? Community access to India's fiber going to 250,000 communities? International sources of finance for Central America? These are topics I can research and report.

For two weeks in Busan, my main work will be asking ""What is the Internet like in your country? How will things change? What can the international community and institutions do to help you bring the net to the unserved, make it robust and keep the cost affordable? Who are the people to watch, especially young people, that will create the future?"" Mostly I'll be listening for what other issues are important.

At the end of the event, November 9, I'll put together a portrait of today's Internet and what's coming soon. I've already spoken with Secretary-General Hamadoun Touré, successor, Houlin Zhao, U.S. Ambassador Sepulveda, Facebook's drone guy, and folks at nearly every major U.S. net company. In Busan, I'll interview dozens of leaders from around the world. My real strength is technical - I have depth in DSL, cable, fiber and now 4G/5G wireless.

I'll be spending the prior week at the Broadband World Forum in Amsterdam, connecting with the Europeans. I've interviewed most of the top Europeans, including Ministers and Commissioners from England, France & Germany. At WCIT and other events, I've met the Ministers from Qatar, Nigeria, Kenya, Serbia and India and dozens of their colleagues.  Who we are    I'm considered one of the world's broadband experts after reporting since 1999. I can give off the top of my head a good summary of broadband today, with figures, for dozens of countries. While I know the basics of almost everywhere, I haven't had the chance to go into depth with leaders in Africa, Asia and Latin America. That's why I'm going to Busan. The world needs to know how the Internet is changing and I intend to be one of those telling the story. I've written two books. I've spoken at Columbia, the U.S. Broadband Plan, the ITU Broadband Commission and around the Western world. My reporting has been picked up by the NY Times, Wall Street Journal and slews of technical publications.      $2,500 will cover part of the expenses for one reporter.  For twice that, we can add a very experienced video producer. If we get company interest and support beyond that, we'll spend it all on further travel to learn more.      If you're in the telecom business, you'll recognize the perks and reporting cost less than half what we would be paid consulting on the same topics.
Please help us understand and report how the Internet will change in the next decade.Dave Burstein",2.0,0,"1 Campaign

column8:
>We're taking more photos than ever, and running out of storage more often.


We surveyed 2,324 people, and the most frequent frustrations experienced by people who love taking photos were:

""I take too many photos, and I keep running out of room.""

""I hate deleting photos to make room for more. It kills the moment.""

""The more photos I have, the more disorganised they get.""

""I can never find the photo I want to share on my smartphone.""

column1: The Goal for IceCream is to Free Up Space on your iPhone, and do it Fast.

column2: >Find out more at: www.givemeicecream.com
column8:
>IceCream offers 3 KEY FEATURES:


   1 . Free Up Space On Demand

   2. Do it Fast

   3. Space-Saving Camera
column9:
>

1. FREE UP SPACE
column13: >Imagine a clever app that allows you to Free Up Space for 250, 1000, 2,500 or even 5,000 more photos on demand. Wouldn't that be a dream come true? Imagine if the app could tell you when you only had space for a few more photos, or even intelligently began freeing up space for you? That's what IceCream does.
column17:
>IceCream backs up a fixed number of original, full resolution photos to the secure IceCream Cloud (build on Amazon's massively robust, scalable and safe data centers). It then optimises the images, reducing the file size by 90%, keeping beautiful gorgeous copies on your phone, even offline. We then help you remove the big images from your device (now that they're safe in the Cloud).


2. SPEED IS GOOD

Through some amazing technology, and our experience at Imperial and MIT, we've been able to make both the backing up process, and the image optimisation process super fast. We have Free Up Space for 250 more photos in about 40 seconds, and for 2,500 photos in about 2 minutes. That's magic.

column5: >IceCream also gives you a great alternative to the default camera app
column9:
>. With the IceCream Camera you can take full resolution, gorgeous photos - and back those up to the secure IceCream Cloud instantly. But we keep only an optimise version on your device to save space. That's clever. And means you can take 10x more photos. That's sweet.


Don't Apple and Dropbox already do this?

NO! They don't. We've been devotees of Apple and Dropbox for years, but we don't think their solutions are good enough. Let's explain why:

column1: Limited and Expensive Storage. Dropbox costs $120 (£70) per year for the cheapest option (and they only give you 2 Gb of storage for free). Apple is also expensive, with the cheapest option (not launching until late 2014) costing $12 (£7) per year but it only offers a fraction of the Dropbox storage.

No Organisation. Too Complex. Unfortunately Dropbox is not integrated with a camera app, doesn't auto-organise your photos and doesn't make it easy to create or share albums. Apple, similarly makes it complicated with three different products - Camera, Photos and iCloud. Why can't it be one single app? Why can't it be organised a lot better?

Anti-Social. Dropbox is designed for files, not photos. As a result its not particularly social. It doesn't even have a friend list to show you who's sharing what with you? Similarly, Apple has never managed to make their products social. Even the iCloud Photo Stream feature is clunky at best, and could be made soooo much better.

LOVE PHOTOS? GET INVOLVED:

  • We're raising £10,000 to complete the prototype IceCream app
• The first version will be for iPhone only (Android will come later)
• You can actively test the app and tell us which features you like and what you'd like more of
• We want YOU to help us craft our strategy moving forward

We love a delicious treat here at IceCream, and there are serious perks on offer in our appreciation of your involvement (Check them all out on the RIGHT).

A Great Team

We have a solid team of developers and computer scientists: with backgrounds in image optimisation, compression, storage and machine vision. We're going to combine that deep knowledge into an app that is super simple, and fun to use.

The Team is led by George Berkowski App of the Year Award Winner from Apple (for the HAILO app) and one of the earliest team members and led the Product Design and Development.
column5: >with a decade of experience building iOS applications for startups and big corporations are running the tech.

column1: Researchers from Imperial College and MIT are behind the powerful image processing and machine learning technology that makes the app magical.
column7:
>Future Challenges

We haven't solved all the challenges just yet, but we have the team who can.

column1: Image recognition and tagging. We already have some amazing image recognition working to categorise your photos automatically - so that you can search for them simply, quickly and intelligently. While it is already robust, we do foresee significant ongoing investment in this area to keep improving the service.

Lowering storage costs. We are constantly striving to rollout better technology and hardware to store your photos more cost-efficiently. The better this technology becomes, the cheaper and more robust we can make the service.

Unforeseen challenges. Naturally, there are plenty of unforeseen challenges which will arise. It's great news that our team has launched numerous previous startups before, and managed a number of successful exits. We're ready for the challenge!

You Can Always Help

Everyone takes photos on their smartphone:

  • That means you have an opinion - and we'd love to hear it
• What is the biggest pain you have now? We want to solve it.

• If you have a wish list ... tell us...

    • Get in touch with any questions: hello@givemeicecream.com

    And please share our campaign on Twitter and Facebook!

StartupBus is loved by Time Magazine, Inc., Huffington Post, Techcrunch, and many news channels including CNN, ABC7 etc. StartupBus is in its 4th year of competition. The goal is for teams to create, develop, and pitch a new startup while on-board a bus bound for South-by-Southwest (SXSW) in Austin TX. This year's trip will have a camera crew on-board to document the journey for a television reality show or documentary release.

I have been selected to be on-board the westcoast bus traveling to Austin starting in San Francisco on March 3, 2013. Along the way I will form a team, build an idea, get customers, make buzz on internet and prepare a pitch for competition against the other teams/buses.

Besides this great journey with entrepeneurs, the winners might get funding from an investor and build a viable business. At the very least, it is an opportunity for me to exercise my business/strategy knowledge and develop relationships in the StartupBus community that I can bring back to my hometown San Jose, CA
I am Prateek Gupta, and I am a 23 years old broke cofounder/CEO of a promising startup based in Silicon Valley. We are currently seeking investment round, and getting good attention out there.

I am living with my parents to pursue my startup dream, and make it big in the Valley. 100% of my time is dedicated to my unpaid job at my startup, and I am learning and making so many things possible to change the way people communicate through video conferencing. (more on that in the link below)

In June 2012, I started my startup with a friend, made a solid team out of a San Francisco hackathon, won second place there. We launched the company at DEMO Fall Conference in October 2012 with full scholarship and valuation of $1.5 million among 75 startups from 15 countries. (more on that in the links below)

The reason I want to join this startupbus so desparately is because I want to learn and meet great people who are on a mission to start new things to change the world. Currently, I have around $350 dollars in cash, and I have no idea where I will be living in Austin, and where I will be eating. This is why I need your help.
$10: I will give you a shoutout online (twitter/facebook/linkedin/myblog)
$25: I will write a blog post about anything you may like
$50: Two hours of brainstorming ideas with you (One hour drive from San Jose or Skype), and will motivate you to pursue them.
I understand if you can't contribute money in this campaign but please help me by sharing this with your family, friends &

IP-based calling is the wave of the future, with companies like Vonage and Magic Jack causing significant disruptions in the business models of local and regional companies. Many people wonder - when will this same revolution occur in mobile phones?

Simply put, Froip.me transforms your smartphone into a hybrid internet phone. Using your current dialer and contact list, Froip.me transmits your calls via the internet. Unlike current mobile VoIP apps, which require you to install and use a separate dialer and contact list, Froip.me operates entirely in the background, intercepting the calls you make and transmitting them via the internet. This gives you:
• Unlimited talk time WITHOUT a cell phone voice plan (Save $500 or more per year!)
• FREE calls to the United States from anywhere in the world (requires WiFi or data connection)
• Freedom from talk limits, coverage gaps, and roaming charges
• The ability to call from 3G, 4G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth or any other mobile internet connection
And best of all, there is no new app interface to learn! Froip.me users can call any US number (even non-Froip.me users) for free!

Our goal is to provide unlimited, FREE voice communication worldwide. We have developed an Android app and voice communications service that will serve as the backbone of this effort. With just $9,999 in contributions and a pilot group of 2000-2500 founding users, we can begin making this goal a reality. With a contribution of as little as $4, you can be one of these founding users and help revolutionize the way the world talks.

As a founding member, you'll get access to the Froip.me app months before it becomes available to the general public, and you'll be able to help drive the development and evolution of our service to suit your needs.

Today, we have a working mobile application, a proven voice server architecture, and some initial agreements with phone carriers in the United States. We're less than a month away from launching our service, but we need a little bit of help to get the rest of the way there. Our upcoming needs include:
• Scaling our server systems to support large volumes of concurrent calls
• 2000-2500 founding users for a pilot program to test our offering and gather vital user feedback
• Finishing development of our first application based on user feedback
• Securing long-term contracts with call termination providers to guarantee free service years into the future
To make it worth your while, here's what we're offering:
• Participation in our beta/pilot program - get free, unlimited calls starting in January, months before the general public!
• Invitations for your friends and family to join before the service is generally available
<li>An edgy Froip t-shirt with text of your choosing! (subject to review
column2: threatening, hateful or obscene text may be refused at our discretion)

column1: • A Wi-Fi-enabled Android phone with the Froip.me application pre-installed and configured: Ditch your cell phone provider!

Contributors participating in the beta will start receiving their copies of the application in mid- to late January, before the campaign is even over! If we hit our $10k goal, beta users will begin receiving their invitations within 30 days of the end of the campaign, and the free Froip.me service to be publicly available in the first half of 2013.
If we don't hit our funding goal, all money raised will fund the pilot program for all founding members
column2: however, the invitations and public launch may be delayed.

column1: If we raise $20,000 or more, ALL founding users will have the opportunity to join our ongoing Froip.me Focus Group - a group of individuals who get access to key Froip.me features and upgrades before the general public. These users will have the opportunity to be involved in deciding which features are developed and improved infuture versions.

James Hammons and Pervez Syed started Froip.me after meeting at Thunderbird School of Global Management. As frequent international travelers with heavy calling needs, we understand the frustration with today's mobile phone market. We're paying outrageous monthly plan rates, coupled with exorbitant international use fees, to do something as simple as transmit voice communication. There is a better way.

We envision a world where communication in ALL forms is unbound by geography, home network, time of day and minute allotments - where your voice is as free and ubiquitous as the internet. Froip.me is a critical first step to bringing this world to life.
While we would love a contribution, there are other things you can do to help! Follow us on Twitter (@FroipMe), tweet your thoughts (
column3: hashtags=froip,free,voip"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">#Froip), 'like' FroipMe on Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/froip), and tell your friends about this campaign! This is your chance to tell the cell phone companies EXACTLY what you think about their outrageous rates - make it count!

column2: >To avoid the bulk of carrying amp stack or navigating through some awkwardly designed UI and laggy OS on digital audio players, Capri is AAW's latest offering for ultra portable music application. Designed to achieve Hi-Res music on-the-go and stay uncompromised on sound quality and mobility.

>Without internal battery, storage, screen, complex operating system software, Capri uses your iPhone for these non-audio related functions and really focuses on the sound design while lowering the overall cost. Therefore we can deliver sound quality which usually costs a few hundred dollars at a fraction of the price tag. Here comes Capri, barely bigger than the footprint of a traditional analog IEM cable, it brings an entirely new breed of portable audio experience on the table!

column1: Capri can be ordered as complete earphone package with Capri In-Ear Monitor or standalone cable with MMCX/2Pin male connectors.
• Carbon Fibre Faceplate with Engineering Thermoplastic Shell.
Here is the video of our fuctioning prototype being tested

column2: >Featuring AAW's advanced acoustic designs, Capri offers 24bit high resolution digital conversion. Balanced DAC/HPA offers differential audio signal with up to 128mw output power to feed the most demanding earphones. Carefully designed audio signal path and premium grade electronic components meet the most strict interference elimination requirement and keeps an ultra low output impedance.

>Specially designed for this campaign and backers without a detachable cable enabled IEM. The Capri UIEM (Universal In-Ear Monitor) is armed with 9.2mm Beryllium Physical Vapor Deposited diaphragm with Neodymium magnet micro-drivers. The PVD synthesised superconductive Beryllium thin film coating is able to achieve a thickness of 0.2 micron while maintaining excellent physical integrity and rigidness.  This translates to excellent transient response and extraordinary resolution. It is also equipped with 3 sets of inter-changeable gold/chromium plated brass nozzles, each with a unique sound signature to better suit your musical taste. For this campaign we only provide 2Pin option for Capri UIEM.
>Prototypes of the Capri Universal In-Ear Monitor
>Final color of Capri UIEM will be black + carbon faceplate

>Coming from a Custom In-Ear Monitor maker, what AAW does best is to make your earphone looks as fancy as it sounds. After consulting with Indiegogo and discussing with our tooling suppliers, we decided this will be our first stretch goal!
>If no customization perk is chosen, default setup will be black shell/silver trim/CF faceplate.

>For backers with existing branded IEMs, Capri digital cable offers 2Pin and MMCX. 2Pin connectors are in 0.78mm size,  MMCX on the other hand fits universal IEMs from most major brands. The angled design offers the most ergonomic cable entry angle for the best wearing experience. Capri is connected to iPhone 7/7 Plus via the Lightning connector and has retrospective compatibility up to iOS 7.2 and above.
>Users who wish to use connectors other than MMCX/2Pin please see FAQ section for details.
>Capri cable prototype matched with AAW's custom in-ear creations:

>Both the analog and digital cables on Capri are constructed with 99.9997% purity OCC copper wires, supplied by our long time partner, cable specialist Null Audio. It is of excellent conductivity property and offer very low impedance to ensure obstruction free transportation of both the analog and digital signals. The digital cable connecting the Lightning connector and the control capsule is additionally shielded for maximum protection and to repel EMI interference. Leading into the IEM connector, Capri offers formable memory wire with over-the-ear configuration to keep a secure fit.

>Capri’s control capsule is equipped with a tri-button array, it mirrors the operation of a typical inline remote control with support of volume adjustment, next/previous tracks, answer/end phone call, call up Siri. Capri has high sensitivity microphone and 24bit/48kHz ADC circuitry built-in the control capsule and supports normal/conference phone calls, Siri or any iOS apps which utilise microphone functions. Noise filtering design ensures crystal clear call quality.

>Capri is official MFI approved and utilised Apple’s authorised chipset and Lightning connectors. Its firmware is updatable through its matching iOS app. It is important that Capri’s functionality is uncompromised along with Apple’s future iOS development. Whenever Apple rolls out newer iOS update, Capri will remain in full force and 100% compatible with future protocol changes.

>Capri will be offered with Type-C variant for mainstream Android phones too. Type-C version will share exact hardware with its Lightning counterpart and support phone call and remote functions on mainstream Android phones. You will be offered a selection when you choose the perk.
> W900: World's First 9 Driver Hybrid CIEM

>Developed and enhanced based on our acclaimed hybrid system, W900 is at the summit of our ideology of fusing the best traits out of dynamic and balanced armature drivers. Instead of creating high order RC crossover network, which usually causes chaotic phase shift and scrambled arrival timing, AAW uses a complete new approach called TrueXross to solve the classic coherence issue in hybrid earphones. The dynamic driver is proprietary tuned diaphragm wise and by further utilizing a physical low pass filter, it is to only function in minimal overlapping frequency range as opposed to the balanced armature driver. Coupled with delicate positional arrangement and front acoustic chamber design, AAW is able to achieve improved coherence, minimized phase shift and optimized arrival timing of music signal.

>W900 is designed to be true reference equipment, it offers powerful yet natural sub bass which you will never find in a full balanced armature CIEM. The 4 way crossover network configures dedicated woofer, mid, treble and super tweeters. Inherited AAW's highly praised musical imaging, instrument separation and realistic sound stage, W900 steps up the game by offering extended treble and superior detail retrieval. The end result being a high-end speaker like performance condensed in a tiny footprint of CIEM.

>AAW worked with the best balanced armature maker in the world to develop the bespoke super tweeter drivers used in W900. It ensures non-compromising sound pressure all the way up to 20kHz and further extends to 40kHz.

>Suitable for stage performers, recording studio, audio engineers and the most critical audiophiles. Every AAW custom is customised to fill exact cavity of your ears. The CIEM experience is started with a trip to audiologist to have ear impressions taken and AAW will carefully craft the monitor shells mirroring their shapes. Delicately tuned and matched transducers are then mounted into the shells to create a one of a kind earpiece for you and you only. Universal shape for W900 is also available.

>Advanced AcousticWerkes (AAW) is a Singapore based electric-acoustic company specialised in in-ear monitoring technology. AAW is recognised by the audiophile and professional community for our exquisite hybrid drive technology and bespoke custom in-ear monitor products, during which course we have successfully attracted a diverse clientele consists of pro-musicians, audio engineers as well as serious audiophiles.

column3:
>1. How do I tell a Lightning audio device is authentic MFI approved?
A. If you find your Lightning audio solution does not have one of the following traits: 1) three button array 2) capable to update firmware through iDevice 3) Flexible padding on the Lightning connector where it connects to iDevice, then regardless of its form factor, earphone, cable or adapter, it is probably hacked or fake (with exception to Apple’s own product). Moreover, phone call function is not mandatory on authentic accessories but fake solutions can’t realise this function anyway. So if your Lightning earphones have a nice remote control but unable to make phone calls, it is probably fake.
>2. What would happen if a Lightning audio device is not MFI approved?

A. Capri should able to drive headphones up to 300ohm impedance. Do verify with your headphone manufacturer for compatibility.

>9. Why balanced audio signal?
A. It has been hotly debated in the audiophile community for decades, still we have seen it implemented in a slew of high end portable audio players. In a battery driven, low power scenario, we think it offers significant benefit in terms of noise reduction and power amplification. column1: If you have questions during or after the campaign has closed, you can always reach us at lsu@acousticwerkes.com, we will respond as fast as possible!
For press inquiries please contact kevin@aaw.me
For questions related to the Indiegogo Campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com

To avoid the bulk of carrying amp stack or navigating through some awkwardly designed UI and laggy OS on digital audio players, Capri is AAW's latest offering for ultra portable music application. Designed to achieve Hi-Res music on-the-go and stay uncompromised on sound quality and mobility.

Without internal battery, storage, screen, complex operating system software, Capri uses your iPhone for these non-audio related functions and really focuses on the sound design while lowering the overall cost. Therefore we can deliver sound quality which usually costs a few hundred dollars at a fraction of the price tag. Here comes Capri, barely bigger than the footprint of a traditional analog IEM cable, it brings an entirely new breed of portable audio experience on the table!
Capri can be ordered as complete earphone package with Capri In-Ear Monitor or standalone cable with MMCX/2Pin male connectors.
Carbon Fibre Faceplate with Engineering Thermoplastic Shell.
Here is the video of our fuctioning prototype being tested

Featuring AAW's advanced acoustic designs, Capri offers 24bit high resolution digital conversion. Balanced DAC/HPA offers differential audio signal with up to 128mw output power to feed the most demanding earphones. Carefully designed audio signal path and premium grade electronic components meet the most strict interference elimination requirement and keeps an ultra low output impedance.

Specially designed for this campaign and backers without a detachable cable enabled IEM. The Capri UIEM (Universal In-Ear Monitor) is armed with 9.2mm Beryllium Physical Vapor Deposited diaphragm with Neodymium magnet micro-drivers. The PVD synthesised superconductive Beryllium thin film coating is able to achieve a thickness of 0.2 micron while maintaining excellent physical integrity and rigidness.  This translates to excellent transient response and extraordinary resolution. It is also equipped with 3 sets of inter-changeable gold/chromium plated brass nozzles, each with a unique sound signature to better suit your musical taste. For this campaign we only provide 2Pin option for Capri UIEM.
Prototypes of the Capri Universal In-Ear Monitor
Final color of Capri UIEM will be black + carbon faceplate

Coming from a Custom In-Ear Monitor maker, what AAW does best is to make your earphone looks as fancy as it sounds. After consulting with Indiegogo and discussing with our tooling suppliers, we decided this will be our first stretch goal!
If no customization perk is chosen, default setup will be black shell/silver trim/CF faceplate.

For backers with existing branded IEMs, Capri digital cable offers 2Pin and MMCX. 2Pin connectors are in 0.78mm size,  MMCX on the other hand fits universal IEMs from most major brands. The angled design offers the most ergonomic cable entry angle for the best wearing experience. Capri is connected to iPhone 7/7 Plus via the Lightning connector and has retrospective compatibility up to iOS 7.2 and above.
Users who wish to use connectors other than MMCX/2Pin please see FAQ section for details.
Capri cable prototype matched with AAW's custom in-ear creations:

Both the analog and digital cables on Capri are constructed with 99.9997% purity OCC copper wires, supplied by our long time partner, cable specialist Null Audio. It is of excellent conductivity property and offer very low impedance to ensure obstruction free transportation of both the analog and digital signals. The digital cable connecting the Lightning connector and the control capsule is additionally shielded for maximum protection and to repel EMI interference. Leading into the IEM connector, Capri offers formable memory wire with over-the-ear configuration to keep a secure fit.

Capri’s control capsule is equipped with a tri-button array, it mirrors the operation of a typical inline remote control with support of volume adjustment, next/previous tracks, answer/end phone call, call up Siri. Capri has high sensitivity microphone and 24bit/48kHz ADC circuitry built-in the control capsule and supports normal/conference phone calls, Siri or any iOS apps which utilise microphone functions. Noise filtering design ensures crystal clear call quality.

Capri is official MFI approved and utilised Apple’s authorised chipset and Lightning connectors. Its firmware is updatable through its matching iOS app. It is important that Capri’s functionality is uncompromised along with Apple’s future iOS development. Whenever Apple rolls out newer iOS update, Capri will remain in full force and 100% compatible with future protocol changes.

Capri will be offered with Type-C variant for mainstream Android phones too. Type-C version will share exact hardware with its Lightning counterpart and support phone call and remote functions on mainstream Android phones. You will be offered a selection when you choose the perk.
W900: World's First 9 Driver Hybrid CIEM

Developed and enhanced based on our acclaimed hybrid system, W900 is at the summit of our ideology of fusing the best traits out of dynamic and balanced armature drivers. Instead of creating high order RC crossover network, which usually causes chaotic phase shift and scrambled arrival timing, AAW uses a complete new approach called TrueXross to solve the classic coherence issue in hybrid earphones. The dynamic driver is proprietary tuned diaphragm wise and by further utilizing a physical low pass filter, it is to only function in minimal overlapping frequency range as opposed to the balanced armature driver. Coupled with delicate positional arrangement and front acoustic chamber design, AAW is able to achieve improved coherence, minimized phase shift and optimized arrival timing of music signal.

W900 is designed to be true reference equipment, it offers powerful yet natural sub bass which you will never find in a full balanced armature CIEM. The 4 way crossover network configures dedicated woofer, mid, treble and super tweeters. Inherited AAW's highly praised musical imaging, instrument separation and realistic sound stage, W900 steps up the game by offering extended treble and superior detail retrieval. The end result being a high-end speaker like performance condensed in a tiny footprint of CIEM.

AAW worked with the best balanced armature maker in the world to develop the bespoke super tweeter drivers used in W900. It ensures non-compromising sound pressure all the way up to 20kHz and further extends to 40kHz.

Suitable for stage performers, recording studio, audio engineers and the most critical audiophiles. Every AAW custom is customised to fill exact cavity of your ears. The CIEM experience is started with a trip to audiologist to have ear impressions taken and AAW will carefully craft the monitor shells mirroring their shapes. Delicately tuned and matched transducers are then mounted into the shells to create a one of a kind earpiece for you and you only. Universal shape for W900 is also available.

We are entirely relying on world of mouth for PR for our project since majority of funding went into R&D and licensing for Apple. Your help means a lot to us, on the campaign page you will find these buttons to the right of the video. Share and help us spread the news!On the Campaign backend, we will be able to see the referrals from these shares, if your referral led to 8 or more backers, we will reward you with a FREE Capri IEM + Cable Pack(UP. $199)!* Indiegogo account and being existing backer of this campaign are required to participate  and referral cut-off date will be last day of this campaign

Advanced AcousticWerkes (AAW) is a Singapore based electric-acoustic company specialised in in-ear monitoring technology. AAW is recognised by the audiophile and professional community for our exquisite hybrid drive technology and bespoke custom in-ear monitor products, during which course we have successfully attracted a diverse clientele consists of pro-musicians, audio engineers as well as serious audiophiles.

1. How do I tell a Lightning audio device is authentic MFI approved?A. If you find your Lightning audio solution does not have one of the following traits: 1) three button array 2) capable to update firmware through iDevice 3) Flexible padding on the Lightning connector where it connects to iDevice, then regardless of its form factor, earphone, cable or adapter, it is probably hacked or fake (with exception to Apple’s own product). Moreover, phone call function is not mandatory on authentic accessories but fake solutions can’t realise this function anyway. So if your Lightning earphones have a nice remote control but unable to make phone calls, it is probably fake.

2. What would happen if a Lightning audio device is not MFI approved?A. It most likely uses a hacked chipset to communicate with iDevice. Any future iOS update may change protocol and rendering this device useless.
3. How do I know if my earphone has 2PIN or MMCX connector?A. Popular IEM with MMCX connector:
Westone W series, UM Pro series, ES series, AM Pro series
Westone UM2 RC/UM3X RC/4R and all Westone CIEMs
Noble, 64 Audio, Empire Ears, Vision Ears, JH 2-pin series, Earsonics.
most CIEM brands with 0.78mm socket size

4. What if my earphone's connector is neither 2 pin nor MMCX? Can I get customized modification service?A. Please contact authorised mod provider Null Audio to have Capri re-calibrated to 3rd party connectors and keep warranty intact. For the Indiegogo campaign, please contact us after you have backed the campaign, we will ship Capri to Null Audio in advance and have them shipped directly to you after the mod.
5. Do you have a list on supported models for modification?A. Please refer to the list below (non-exhaustive):
Audio Technica IM series, CK100Pro, E40/50/70 (A2DC connector)
6. Is Capri power-hungry?A. Capri consumes only less than 2% of the battery power per hour, therefore it is very power efficient.
7. How long is Capri's warranty?A. One year parts & labor.
8. Is Capri digital cable powerful enough to drive my headphones?A. Capri should able to drive headphones up to 300ohm impedance. Do verify with your headphone manufacturer for compatibility.

9. Why balanced audio signal?A. It has been hotly debated in the audiophile community for decades, still we have seen it implemented in a slew of high end portable audio players. In a battery driven, low power scenario, we think it offers significant benefit in terms of noise reduction and power amplification. For working principle of balanced audio signal path, see this link.
10. I have Android phone with micro-USB port, can I use Capri?A. We have no plan to support micro-USB at the moment.

Supply Chain: Capri has utilised certain Apple supplied chipsets, which have long and sometime unpredictable lead-time and inventory. Information regarding lead-time is occasionally limited too. Most of Capri's tooling is done in-house by AAW, while minor but important bits such as some flexible parts are outsourced. Planning and control are serious tasks at hand.

Delivery: AAW has mature logistic department. However, we are accustomed to low volume/high value shipments such as custom in-ear monitors. With volume rises, AAW team strives to provide as efficient and timely shipping as possible. Shipping method wise, Singpost and FedEx are our long time partners. All shipments will be traceable and insured.

Customer Service: Similar to logistic, AAW's service team is excellent in handling various volume levels of high complexity service flow. Our staffs are well-trained and deep-knowledged about our products. They will step up and prove themselves to be capable of handling broader client base.

Quality Control: AAW is meticulous about our CIEM production and quality checks. We have accumulated much experience in large volume production as our Nebula and Q UIEM are picking up pace. Complete quality control process has been implemented with IQC, IPQC and PQC procedures in place, material or finished products will all go through multiple checks.
If you have questions during or after the campaign has closed, you can always reach us at lsu@acousticwerkes.com, we will respond as fast as possible!
For press inquiries please contact kevin@aaw.me
For questions related to the Indiegogo Campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com",43.0,2,"1 Campaign

Short Summary

Have you ever tried to change something? If the answer is no, then go and try, because when you finally succeed  it is the most fulfilling feeling you can obtain.

Our team at WAYkoo is a group of teenagers put together by a 16 year old male from British Columbia, Canada because he had the desire to change the tech world for the better by using recycled (green) materials.

Once we have our product on the shelves of stores, 15% of profits are to be donated to the WWF foundation.

Please help us out we are only teenagers (14-19)


What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

If we get the $5,000,000 we are going to put it towards R&
column3:
D and get our first beta phones tested by you, the funders. Once funding ends a draw will happen and a few lucky people will get a free beta phone to review and then keep!

Not reaching our goal will NOT be the end of the road. 

We are only 16, we have our whole lives ahead of us to make this happen and are eager to begin our journey to a tech revolution.

We believe in our product and want you to as well.


The Impact

The impact of our eco-friendly phones will grow bigger by the day! With funding and time, our product line is going to expand from just smartphones to tablets, laptops and pc's

We believe that with your help we can start an eco-friendly tech revolution allowing big companies to see what ""the little guy"" can actually do!

7 billion people can help us ""make the change""


Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute, that doesn't mean you cant help:

Please spread the word on social networks and sites, and by the good ol’ word of mouth. Help make an impact on the future of our Earth.

Featured on

column2: >The fastest, lightest, hassle free gaming controller for your iOS, PC, Mac, or Tablet games.

>Console Gaming should no longer be limited to ""at home play"". With advanced tablet graphics, massive game library's and the Flipside controller, an incredible gaming option is finally available to the masses.
>With proper funding we can be market ready in 6 months. iOS 7 launches this fall, giving a 4 month head start for developers for gaming compatibility.

>Using solid state thin film batteries, solar charging, and Bluetooth 4's low energy profile we can make a light, thin, overmolded plastic case for the iPhone or any mobile device that houses the controls we need for gaming.

column1: This is the best part. Anywhere. Real games, real fun, real easy.

Flipside is a new and extremely simple way to play console games. It's the least amount of hassle for the maximum amount of gaming bliss. There is NO reason to lug around consoles, tv's and bags full of gear anymore. Flipside proposes to be the fastest, lightest, full featured gaming controller on the market. One of the best things about the controller is it NEVER needs to be plugged in to charge. It immediately starts working using ambient light and can hold a charge for over 6 hours with no light. It works directly with your iPhone, iPad, Windows PC, Mac, and yes, EVEN Android games. Imagine what iPhone gaming would be like with a real controller. Apple, has been imagining the same thing. It's with great excitement that we are joining in with Apples vision for the next level of gaming. It all begins with the launch of iOS 7 this fall, and it gets exciting with the launch of the Flipside controller. But we need your help to speed up our production.
<h3>Click Contribute to help speed up our production timeline. ----  &gt

(we will be making the controller regardless of this campaign. Contributions will go directly to funding and speeding up the production process and will not get lost or invalidated by us not hitting our $40k goal. Perks will still be filled regardless of hitting $40k, just a slightly later date. If you click contribute, you can contribute and select ""no perks"". Serious investors can contact invest@solarflipside.com)

column2: >The Flipside controller is the best choice for the gamer on the go.
>The controller we are making is a dream device!

column1: * COMPLETELY WIRELESS
column2: title=""no wires ever needed for charging ""/>

column1: This means not a single cable, not to plug it into the phone, or into the wall. With this          case you won't have to stop and think about what else you need to bring.

column2: title=""Bluetooth low energy""/>* ULTRA FAST BLUETOOTH 4.0 LOW ENERGY

column1: Besides being 16x faster than older Bluetooth, this means we will have the highest compatibiilty with any device supporting Bluetooth. (Bluetooth 4.0 required for optimal battery life)

column2: title=""flipside, lightweight and ultra portable""/>  * LIGHTWEIGHT

column1: By using the iPhone body for rigidity we are able to make a very solid very lightweight controller that wraps and protects your phone whle providing the most coveted functionality to your phone. True gaming controls.

column2: title=""solar charging for iPhone Flipside gaming case""/>

column1: Solar charges inside and out faster than it depletes. Store your phone in your pocket? Not a problem, almost as soon as the case hits the light its ready to go. (think old school solar calculator) Dark place no light at all? The Flipside case holds over 5+ hrs of projected battery life and is usable while it charges.

column2: title=""We have a full set of gaming controls, dual analog controls, triggers, shoulders and plenty of good old fashioned buttons! ""/>* A FULL SET OF GAMING CONTROLS

column1: This is not just a game controller for your phone, but your computer games as well. So we have added a full set of gaming controls (triggers, dual analog controls, shoulder buttons)

column5: permguid=30654de5-09ff-4513-8cd3-d98d1acad715"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" title=""ios 7 game controller compatibility iphone 5 iphone 5s iphone 6"">IOS 7 compatibility

column1: Controllers are only useful if you have games to use them with. With iOS 7 adding a standard for gaming controllers we now have the BEST SOLUTION for game compatibility. No Hacks! This is OFFICIAL APPLE support.
*  Looks beautiful on your iPhone 5
*  Will support future iPhone releases iPhone 5s/iPhone 6

And the best part is that we have a working prototype! This multifunctional device is already proving to be a serious ""game changer,"" so-to-speak in the gaming device community.  We wanted to give you the BEST.  Which is why this is such an exciting project to invest in. Join us in the beginning of the next generation of high-end gaming fun, but priced for REAL PEOPLE.

column2: >We believe we are the best solution for iPhone gaming

column3: >

column1:
We are the only solar powered controller, so there is nothing to carry but your phone with its ""Flipside"" case. Unlike many of our competitors we are FULL FEATURED. We believe we are the easiest, most natural case to hold, meaning long gaming sessions will be fun, not painful. 

The Founder

Justice Frangipane, the founder of Solar Flipside LLC, is known world wide for his creative ingenuity and extreme athletisism. He has tied two world records, one for a twisting quadruple flip. The other for doing a backflip with 2,160 degrees of twisting rotation, as well as competing in the 2008 Olympic trails for trampoline. He has performed live on the show America's Got Talent as well as NBA and NHL games. He has done promotional work for the likes of Skechers, Vuly Trampolines, and Adidas. He has been head hunted by Jaybird Audio, Cirque Du Soleil, and Disney Entertainment. He has accomplished a wide variety of creative endeavors, including serving as Production Manager for Aerial Experience Productions.

column2: title=""Justice Frangipane""/>If you ask him the secret to his success he will tell you this, ""Surround yourself with people who are great at what you want to do. Be humble, learn. column1: Justice is a thankful Christian, and son of the world reknown author Francis Frangipane.

Justice grew up an avid gamer in Cedar Rapids, Iowa. Owning and extensively using an Atari 2600, Commadore 64/128, NES, Sega Master System, SNES, Genesis, Sega 32x, Neo Geo, Sega CD, Saturn, N64, Gameboy, Nintendo Game Cube, Game Gear, Atari Lynx, Atari Jaguar, PsOne, PSP, Playstation 2, Xbox, Dreamcast (Japanese import), Dreamcast, Xbox 360, Wii, Playstation 3, just to name a few.

Every console had controllers with buttons. Transitioning to a touch screen had its many woes. Touch screen gaming has many limitations and only a few benefits. With the vast majority of games suffering from a lack of better controls, Justice knew a change would be coming. When it didn't come when, or how he had hoped, He knew he had to get involved in providing the solution he wanted. This is how the Flipside was born.
